description.narrative: -Practical and Technical skills training and capacity strengthening of local partners, -Knowledge material development and Impact and result evidence documentation, -Networking and partnership development, -Project management and coordination
Knowledge, Innovation and efficiency for community intervention

The project will work to improve the organisational capacity of local organisations and local government agriculture and water bureaus to ensure efficient expansion of and continued delivery of quality Rainwater harvesting and WASH projects. Then project will strengthen partners through practical trainings and knowledge and best practice documentation, with the goal of increasing partner capacity to act as development facilitators and to operate as sustainable entities.

This 'Local Capacity Support' project will work to improve the organisational capacity of local organisations and local government agriculture and water bureaus to ensure efficient expansion of and continued delivery of quality Rainwater Harvesting and WASH projects. The project will strengthen partners through practical trainings and knowledge and best practice documentation, with the goal of increasing partner capacity to act as development facilitators and to operate as sustainable entities.

This information will soon be available

To increase the readiness and contextual understanding of the local challenges by strengthen technical skills and draw local knowledge and context, RAIN partners with governments, civil society and private sector to design and implement locally appropriate technologies and scalable interventions in WASH, food security, ecosystem conservation, and environmental protection.
